---
title: "Marketing Database"
format: revealjs
---

## 1. Leads Table

Description: This table is your list of potential customers. It stores the "who" – any person who has shown interest in your business but hasn't necessarily bought anything yet. Each lead gets a unique ID.

::: {style="font-size: 0.8em;"}
| lead_id | email | source |
|---------|-------|--------|
| 1 | sarah.j@example.com | Web Form |
| 2 | kevin.lee@example.com | Newsletter Sign-up |
| 3 | amanda.w@example.com | Trade Show |
| 4 | brian.c@example.com | Web Form |
:::

## 2. Campaigns Table

Description: This table is your list of marketing activities. It stores the "what" – the different campaigns you are running to try and attract leads. Each campaign gets a unique ID.

::: {style="font-size: 0.8em;"}
| campaign_id | campaign_name | channel |
|-------------|---------------|---------|
| 10 | Spring 2025 Sale | Email |
| 11 | Free Trial Offer | PPC (Google Ads) |
| 12 | Holiday Gift Guide | Social (Instagram) |
| 13 | Summer Clearance | Email |
:::

## 3. Conversions Table

Description: This table links the leads and campaigns tables together. It records the "action" – which lead responded to which campaign, what they did, and when it happened. The lead_id and campaign_id columns refer back to the first two tables.

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
| conversion_id | lead_id | campaign_id | conversion_date | action |
|---------------|---------|-------------|-----------------|--------|
| 500 | 1 | 10 | 2025-06-15 09:15:00 | Email signup |
| 501 | 3 | 12 | 2025-07-22 11:30:00 | Download guide |
| 502 | 1 | 11 | 2025-08-03 14:00:00 | Trial signup |
| 503 | 2 | 10 | 2025-08-18 16:45:00 | Email signup |
:::
